titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Julean Herbert Arnold papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Charles G. Palm

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-02-23T11:10-0800

change.item: Revised to add links to digital collections site by Sarah Patton.
Declassified materials returned to collection by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Julean Herbert Arnold papers)//EN" "reg_283.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Diary, correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, dispatches, instructions, and memoranda relating to the American consular service in China, economic and political developments in China, and American commercial and foreign policy in East Asia. Digital copy of Arnold's diary also available at http://digitalcollections.hoover.org

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copy of Arnold's diary also available at http://digitalcollections.hoover.org

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Julean Herbert Arnold papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1973.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copy of Arnold's diary also available at http://digitalcollections.hoover.org

chronitem.event: U.S. Commercial Attaché in China and Japan
Founder, American Chamber of Commerce, Shanghai
Chairman, American Delegation to China Tariff Revision Commission, Shanghai
Author, China: A Commercial and Industrial Handbook
Author, Some Bigger Issues in China's Problems
Author, China Through the American Window

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Diary, correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, dispatches, instructions, and memoranda relating to the American consular service in China, economic and political developments in China, and American commercial and foreign policy in East Asia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Diary and diary notes, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, arranged chronologically within the folder labeled "General" and alphabetically by last name of correspondent for the remaining folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of speeches and writings, arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Address before the Credit Managers Association of Northern and Central California,
"America's Concern Over What Happens in China"
"Agriculture in the Economic Life of the New China,"
"China: Our Best New Source of Wealth,"
"China's Railways--Present and in the Post-war Future,"
Digest of Julean Arnold's statement before the Foreign Affairs Committee,
"Do Our China Missionaries Merit Your Support?,"
"Effect of Sino-Japanese Crisis Upon the Future of America"
"How American Merchants and Manufacturers May Enter China,"
"How Can Our Movie Films Help Our Trade with China?"
"Is Japan Blasting America Out of the Pacific?"
"Is Japan Blitzkrieging America Out of the Pacific?,"
"Japanese Attitude toward American Interests in China"
"Making the Shanghai American Chamber of Commerce More Effective"
"Millions for Educating the East to Know the West but Not One Cent to Train the West to Know the East,"
"Museum Method of Introducing American Goods into China,"
"Notes for 'Home and Abroad' from Shanghai Office,"
"Our Stake in the Future of China,"
Outline of talk at Hammond Hospital, Modesto, California,
"Proposed 'China House,' 'Asia House,' or 'House of the Orient' for Pacific Coast Ports,"
Review of Albert Herrmann's Atlas of China
"Should the U.S. Get Out of China?,"
"Suggestions for Revitalizing the Department of Commerce"
"They Thought China Had Nothing to Teach Them"
"Tung Oil Industry Developments in United States,"
"Twenty-eight Suggestions for Improving American-Chinese Trade Relations,"
"U.S. and China in the Post-war World"
"Western Educated Student's Opportunity in the Commercial Life of the New China"
"What China Yields in Peace and War"
"What Does China's Modernization Mean to Us?,"
"What Will a Japanese Victory Mean to American Cotton?"
"What Would a Japanese Victory in China Mean to America?,"
Invitations and appreciations for speaking engagements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, despatches, instructions, correspondence, memoranda, lists, scrapbook, and printed matter, arranged by subseries. The offices and positions held by Julean Arnold, including American Assessor for the International Mixed Court, U.S. Consul in China, and U.S. Commercial Attaché in China, constitute the subseries.

did.unittitle: Report on Interference of the Shanghai Municipal Council in Matters Pertaining to the International Mixed Court,
Reports on Tours Across West China,
Despatches and weekly reports to the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce, Department of Commerce

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declassified U.S. government records returned to file after July 2015 release by Hoover.

did.unittitle: Information and correspondence file on China
Status of Commercial Attaché and relationship with State Department

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, newsletters, lists, clippings, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: American Chambers of Commerce in China
China-America Council of Commerce and Industry,
United National Relief and Rehabilitation Administration,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, mailing lists and calling cards, maps, memorabilia, and miscellaneous printed matter, arranged as listed.

did.unittitle: 25 photos of maps of China, of a U.S. trade display in Shanghai, and of Julean Arnold and family
40 photos of scenes of daily life in China, including photos and drawings of typical Chinese tools
1 photo and 30 ink drawings of Chinese trade products
